pages.text:
OUR MISSION
Celebrating Aviation - Honoring Its Past & Inspiring Its Future
The Stuart Air Show is a 501 (C) (3) non-profit organization. For more than 36 years, it has been dedicated to honoring the history of American aviation and veterans. Each year the air show attracts
tens of thousands of attendees
and partners with schools and children's service agencies to offer STEM and other educational opportunities to hundreds of school-age children. The Stuart Air Show also partners with non-profits such as EAA Chapter 692, Southeast Florida Honor Flight, the U.S. Naval Sea Cadet Corps, and the United Way of Martin County as well as providing fundraising opportunities for dozens of other Martin and St. Lucie County-based charities.
OUR IMPACT
Support for Local Non-Profits
The Stuart Air Show endeavors to serve the community year-round by donating tickets and on occasion funds to area non-profits. To request a donation please complete
this form
.
Please consider the following before making your request:
The organization benefitting from the donation must be a non-profit 501 (C)(3).
Please have your supporting documentation ready before starting the form.
The individual making the request should be an employee of the organization or authorized to make the request.
All requests must be received no fewer than 30 days before your event.
All requests must be made between January 1 - October 1.  Requests made between October-December will not be approved.
Please allow seven business days for a response to your request.
APPLY NOW
supporting the Community
Gallery Grid
“
The Stuart Air Show and United Way have forged an incredible partnership that has spanned several years. We are grateful for their unwavering support to help those in Martin County who need a hand up. We hope to continue this relationship for years to come.
”
— Carol G. Houwaart-Diez, President/CEO United Way Martin County
“
Gift of support from the Stuart Air Show is beyond appreciated. With these funds we are able to help ensure safe childcare and healthy living opportunities for even more families in our community!  We couldn’t continue to live our mission without amazing partners like the Stuart Air Show!
”
— Elisha N. Stoecklin, Executive Branch Director YMCA of the Treasure Coast
“
The Stuart Airshow means aviation, history and inspiration; the power and wonder of flight that captivates and motivates our youth, the future leaders of this great nation. We are thrilled to be a part of the show and to receive their continued support.
”
— Cindy Saulog, U.S. Naval Sea Cadet Corp, American Veterans Division

history of witham field
Today, Witham Field with its three runways, serves most of the general aviation needs for Martin County and surrounding areas. The airport, just a few miles southeast of the City of Stuart, can accommodate most general aviation aircraft including smaller business jets, and is home to more than 200 private and business aircraft. It also plays host to the largest community event on the Treasure Coast, the annual Stuart Air Show. The airports fixed-based-operators (FBO’s) act as the local terminals for all its users and those visiting Martin County from other locales.
The history of Witham Field is emblematic of the people and County in which it resides. Its very beginning is deeply rooted in duty, patriotism and generosity from the residents of Martin County. As with many rural airports in the 30’s, Martin County Airport was just a grass landing strip. But with the rumblings of war overseas in the 40’s, a group of visionary and patriotic private landowners convened and offered their property to the county, to serve their county.
